B

BibliographicProduct - Class in model
The BibliographicProduct class contains methods and variables related to bibliographic products such as books, including their ID, name, number of pages, publication date, URL, value, amount of sales, and amount of pages read.
BibliographicProduct(String, int, Calendar, String, double) - Constructor for class model.BibliographicProduct
The BibliographicProduct class represents a bibliographic product in the library system, which has a name, number of pages, publication date, URL, ID, value, amount of sales and amount of pages read.
Book - Class in model
The Book class extends the BibliographicProduct class and includes variables for review and gender, as well as methods for setting these variables and generating a random hexadecimal ID.
Book(String, int, Calendar, String, double, String, int) - Constructor for class model.Book
The Book class represents a bibliographic product of type book, which extends from the BibliographicProduct class.
books - Variable in class model.Reader

Premium - Class in model
The "Premium" class extends the "Reader" class and adds functionality to add books and magazines to a list and return a confirmation message with the date and value of the added product.

R

Reader - Class in model
The Reader class contains information about a reader, including their name, ID, current and last session page, and the books and magazines they have access to.
Reader(String, String) - Constructor for class model.Reader
Constructs a new Reader object with a name and an identification number.
readerBuyBook() - Method in class ui.ReadXSystem
This Java function prompts the user to input a reader ID and a book ID, and then calls a controller method to aggregate the book to the reader.

This function prompts the user to input a reader ID and a magazine ID, and then calls a controller method to subscribe the reader to the magazine.
readingSession(String, String, String) - Method in class model.ControllerLibrary
The function simulates a reading session for a reader with options to move forward or backward in the book and displays ads for certain readers.
ReadXSystem - Class in ui
The ReadXSystem class is a Java program that implements a library management system with various functions such as registering readers, managing bibliographic products, and simulating reading sessions.
registerReader() - Method in class ui.ReadXSystem
This function registers a reader by taking input for their type, name, and ID, and then adds them to the system using a controller.
Regular - Class in model
The "Regular" class extends the "Reader" class and contains methods to add books and magazines to their respective lists, with a limit on the number of items that can be added.
Regular(String, String) - Constructor for class model.Regular
Constructs a Regular Reader with the given name and ID.
removeProduct(BibliographicProduct) - Method in class model.Reader
This function removes a bibliographic product (magazine) from a list and returns a message indicating that the user has been unsubscribed from the magazine.
removeProducts(String) - Method in class model.ControllerLibrary
This Java function removes a bibliographic product from a list and removes it from any readers who have borrowed it.
